profileAlternative.name: Brady Kish
profileAlternative.headline: Experienced Project/Program Manager
profileAlternative.summary: During my 12 years in the industry, I've gained an extensive background in program management for B2B marketing projects. I've also managed development projects, consulted on design, and coded more emails that I can count. I perform, record, compose, and teach music in the Seattle area, too.

given.text:
I’ve worked with Brady for over 10 years. He works hard to delight clients internally and externally, has solid problem-solving skills, and has mastered the latest technology for publishing Microsoft customer evidence (GCRP, CloudDam, Percolate, etc.) He’s motivated and driven – he learned to code from scratch! He’s dedicated, committed, and possesses a willingness to do what it takes to get the job done. I highly recommend Brady.
…
See more

Devs are from Mars and Marketers are from Venus, and too often the two camps are at odds -- unless you've got a someone like Brady who can speak each of their respective languages fluently, diplomatically, and efficaciously. I worked alongside Brady for three years and watched him time and again expertly solve difficult technical problems involving case-study publication, mass email marketing campaigns, and more for the world's biggest technology companies. He did all this while working with clients who were often "strong cups of coffee," as they say. He always delivered results and he always exceeded client expectations. Grace under pressure. That's Brady.
…
See more

Brady was great to work with and is a talented developer. I worked with Brady for several years on a number of different projects in a fast paced marketing environment. Though he was new to web development Brady was always eager to learn and quickly picked up the complexity of email development and cross client testing. He built relationships with clients and was more than happy to hop on a call to troubleshoot issues. Brady was a great web developer and team member.
…
See more

I met Brady through the Coffee Shop Jam series while my daughter was a drum student with a fellow instructor. Brady had some talented bass students playing in the jam so I reached out for some bass lessons. Having been self taught prior I was hoping for structure in practice, breaking bad habits, and to start playing some cool grooves. He has helped me with that and more. He has shown me how to plan my practice time for song work, technique, and reading/theory. He also strives to understand the music styles and artists I enjoy and helps with song breakdown so I can get to playing what I love. Artistically, Brady is a great musician. Both his playing and writing show the mastery he has worked hard to achieve over the years. He has many styles he plays with a real groove and zest. It has always given me confidence that his range in music is wide and deep for teaching in our lessons. I feel real fortunate learning from Brady and to know him as a kind and thoughtful person.
…
See more

At the age of 48 I went out and bought a bass guitar. I had zero musical background, but I wanted to learn how to play an instrument. My wife bought me four lessons with Brady as a gift. I walked into my first lesson very nervous and way out of my comfort zone. I literally knew nothing about the instrument I was holding. Because of Brady those first four lessons changed my life. Brady is a very skilled bassist. He is also a very good teacher and one of the nicest and most patient people you will every meet. I highly recommend that any person, at any age, with any amount of experience seeing Brady for bass guitar lessons. I continued with Brady well after those first four lessons. Now I am a bassist in a rock band playing venues around Seattle. I owe it all to Brady and those first four lessons.
…
See more

It was a pleasure working with Brady in supporting Microsoft's Cloud Marketing team. In addition to effectively managing his own projects, he was always willing to lend a hand to teammates, either taking on additional work or using his coding skills to solve problems effectively and efficiently. Most of all, his calm demeanor in the face of frustrating challenges, informed by his wealth of experience serving clients, helped the team stay focused on finding solutions. Any team would be lucky to have him!
…
See more

Brady is a consummate team player. He brings a high level of professionalism and experience to any client facing team. One of his greatest strengths is his ability to advocate for client needs while remaining attentive to company goals - a critical skill for account and project management. I offer my strongest recommendation for Brady, and would welcome the opportunity to work with him in the future.
…
See more

Brady is a consummate professional and a great marketing project manager who possesses a unique blend of natural wisdom and humor. His dedication and willingness has garnered him a following of satisfied clients and appreciative co-workers. Because of his patience, Brady was given extra responsibilities of training his co-workers and acting as an expert in production tools. I am glad that Brady found his way to Projectline.
…
See more
